title: Backup and Cross-Training
content: Single points of failure are vulnerabilities. Cross-training creates redundancyâ€”multiple people can perform critical functions. Backup behaviors mean monitoring others' work and stepping in when needed. This isn't distrust; it's resilience.

scenario.story: A specialized team member is unexpectedly absent during a critical operation. No one else can perform their function. The operation must be delayed at significant cost while alternatives are arranged.

options.A: The absent member should have planned better
options.B: The team should have developed backup capability for critical functions

scenario.explanation: Absences are foreseeable even if specific timing isn't. Critical functions need backup capability. The investment in cross-training pays off when primary performers are unavailable for any reason.
